content:
Considerations when Replacing Chat with Messaging for In-App and Web

Beginning in Summer ’23, Salesforce Chat is in maintenance-only mode. Consider switching to Messaging for In-App and Web, a modernized alternative that offers an asynchronous, persistent conversation experience with your customers.

The Conversation Is Now Asynchronous and Persistent

Messaging for In-App and Web allows conversations to remain in the window beyond a single interaction. With Messaging for In-App and Web, agents and customers can start and stop the conversation, then pick it back up at a later time.

Messaging for In-App and Web Is Part of the New Conversation Platform

The conversation platform also houses Service Cloud Voice, Enhanced Messaging channels such as WhatsApp, and Partner Messaging Channels. Agents get a consistent experience across all channels.

The Chat Features That You Love Are Now in Messaging

Messaging for In-App and Web offers the same features that you enjoyed in chat, plus some key improvements:

* Asynchronous and persistent conversations
* API to delete data
* Individual-Object Linking (IOL)
* Admins can create a library of messaging components
* Conversation intelligence rules
* Omni-channel flow-based routing
* Business Hours
* Estimated Wait Time
* Auto-responses
* Read and delivery receipts
* Agents can send outbound file attachments

The Setup Experience Changed to Ensure Better Results

Create a messaging channel before customizing your deployment. Create a queue, skill, bot, or agent-based Omni-Flow that routes incoming conversations. Configure user verification to ensure asynchronous conversations persist across tabs and devices.

Compare Messaging for In-App and Web Capabilities to Chat Capabilities

Review the benefits of Messaging for In-App and Web and compare it to our legacy chat product. Alternative Solutions for Chat Features That Aren’t Available in Messaging for In-App and Web
title: Replacing Chat with Messaging for In-App and Web
